trans-unit.source: Represents a token provider for issued security tokens.

Care must be taken when caching and reusing security tokens that are returned from the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.IssuedSecurityTokenProvider.GetTokenCore%2A> method, because the security token might become unusable when the channel that the token provider is associated with is closed.

The security token becomes unusable when the requested key type is asymmetric and the thread is running under impersonated context when the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.IssuedSecurityTokenProvider.GetTokenCore%2A> method is called.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.IssuedSecurityTokenProvider"></xref> class.
Aborts the provider.
Asynchronously begins closing the provider.
The <xref href="System.AsyncCallback"></xref> method to execute when the operation completed.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the state of the operation.
An <xref href="System.IAsyncResult"></xref> object that represents the result of an asynchronous operation.
Asynchronously begins closing the provider.
A <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> after which the call times out.
The <xref href="System.AsyncCallback"></xref> method to execute when the operation completed.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the state of the operation.
An <xref href="System.IAsyncResult"></xref> object that represents the result of an asynchronous operation.
Asynchronously begins getting the token core.
A <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> after which the call times out.
The <xref href="System.AsyncCallback"></xref> method to execute when the operation completed.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the state of the operation.
An <xref href="System.IAsyncResult"></xref> object that represents the result of an asynchronous operation.
Asynchronously begins opening the provider.
The <xref href="System.AsyncCallback"></xref> method to execute when the operation completed.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the state of the operation.
An <xref href="System.IAsyncResult"></xref> object that represents the result of an asynchronous operation.
Asynchronously begins opening the provider.
A <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> after which the call times out.
The <xref href="System.AsyncCallback"></xref> method to execute when the operation completed.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the state of the operation.
An <xref href="System.IAsyncResult"></xref> object that represents the result of an asynchronous operation.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the issued tokens are cached.
`True` if the issued tokens are cached; otherwise, `false`.
Closes the provider.
A <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> after which the call times out.
Closes the provider.
Provides registration and deregistration of event handler for the Closed event.
Provides registration and deregistration of event handler for the Closing event.
Gets the default time-out for closing the connection.
For internal use only.
A <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> that represents the default time-out for closing the connection.
Gets the default time-out for opening the connection.
For internal use only.
A <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> that represents the default time-out for opening the connection.
Releases all resources used by the current instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.IssuedSecurityTokenProvider"></xref> class.
Ends the asynchronous call for closing the provider.
An <xref href="System.IAsyncResult"></xref> object that represents the result of an asynchronous operation.
Ends the asynchronous call for getting the token core.
An <xref href="System.IAsyncResult"></xref> object that represents the result of an asynchronous operation.
A security token.
Ends the asynchronous call for opening the provider.
An <xref href="System.IAsyncResult"></xref> object that represents the result of an asynchronous operation.
Provides registration and deregistration of event handler for the Faulted event.
Gets the token core.

Care must be taken when caching and reusing security tokens that are returned from the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.IssuedSecurityTokenProvider.GetTokenCore%2A> method, because the security token might become unusable when the channel that the token provider is associated with is closed.

The security token becomes unusable when the requested key type is asymmetric and the thread is running under impersonated context when the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.IssuedSecurityTokenProvider.GetTokenCore%2A> method is called.
A <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> after which the call times out.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken"></xref> that represents the token core.
Gets or sets the identity verifier.
The identity verifier.
Gets or sets the issued token renewal threshold percentage.
This percentage controls how often the token provider contacts the SecurityTokenService for a new issued token.
For example, if the percentage is 90 percent, then the token provider will contact the SecurityTokenService when 90 percent of the issued token's validity interval is over.
The issued token renewal threshold percentage.
Gets or sets the issuer address.
The issuer address.
Gets or sets the issuer binding.
The issuer binding.
Gets the issuer channel behaviors.
These channel behaviors are added to the channel used by the token provider for the SecurityTokenService.
The key for this collection is the URL of the security token service.
A <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.KeyedByTypeCollection`1"></xref> that contains the behaviors for the issuer channel.
Gets or sets the key entropy mode.
This property is the key entropy mode used by the token provider when negotiating a symmetric key with the SecurityTokenService to use with the issued token.
The key entropy mode.
Gets or sets the maximum time that an issued token will be cached.
A <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> that represents the maximum time that an issued token will be cached.
Gets or sets the message security version.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.MessageSecurityVersion> contains numerous properties that specify version numbers of different components of a message.
The message security version.
Opens the provider.
A <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> after which the call times out.
Opens the provider.
Provides registration and deregistration of event handler for the Opened event.
Provides registration and deregistration of event handler for the Opening event.
Gets or sets the security algorithm suite.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityAlgorithmSuite> object that is returned contains numerous properties that specify security algorithms to use in specific conditions.
It also describes various security capabilities of the service.
The security algorithm suite.
Gets or sets the security token serializer.
The security token serializer.
Gets the communication state.
The communication state.
Gets a value that indicates whether token cancellation is supported.
`True` if token cancellation is supported; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the target address.
The target address.
Gets the token request parameters.
This is a collection of XML elements that the token provider includes as part of the RequestSecurityToken it sends to the SecurityTokenService.
These parameters can be set explicitly by the client or can be obtained from the relying party's security policy.
A collection of XML elements that represent the token request parameters.
